duties_responsibilities.duty: Implement an effective and appropriate capacity management and production monitoring system.
Maintain all MRP planning and scheduling parameters for all 'make' items.
Analyze planned order reports and provide timely release of production work orders specified by the Production Plan.
Interface with production teams and procurement specialists to prioritize the most critical items.
Identify and bring to resolution any production demand/supply imbalances in both volume and mix.
Provide daily guidance and information to the product line team regarding status of production schedules.
Prepare and communicate shortage and backlog reports and provide visibility of other potential interruptions to the Planning Manager.
Monitor production progress against scheduling needs and intervene as necessary to bring deliveries back into compliance with production schedules.
Identify and report opportunities and implement actions continually to reduce waste, shorten lead times, reduce costs, etc.
Report all scheduling capacity and production tracking data statistics and metrics as defined by the Master Schedule policy.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Finance, or a related field (Master's preferred)
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a Supply Chain, Manufacturing, or Finance role.
At least 1 year of experience in production planning and work order management.
